channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The Gen Z job crisis is real: 1.2 million recent grads in the U.K. competed for just 17,000 open roles
item.description: Rob Breare, CEO of independent U.K. school system Malvern College International, said at Fortune’s Global Forum that AI is upending the job hunt as we...

item.title: With two new funds to trumpet, Sequoia’s Roelof Botha opens up about the state of the VC market—and about the firm’s controversial partner
item.description: The managing partner of Silicon Valley's storied VC firm had a lot of news to discuss in his appearance at a San Francisco startup conference.

item.title: Netflix and Amazon Prime are using AI algorithms that hide content from some users, media executive says
item.description: “The larger problem comes in distribution and the use of algo when content is being shown,” Reliance Industries media president Jyoti Deshpande said.

item.title: Ray Dalio is guided by gratitude: Why CEOs need to find their codifying principles
item.description: Also: All the news and watercooler chat from Fortune.

item.title: Gen Zers are using AI to skip meetings, get promoted faster and win bigger salary hikes. But they don’t feel great about it
item.description: While AI note-taking saves workers hours each week and drives faster promotions, the same young employees worry that their dependence on the tech coul...

item.title: Why the odds of gas prices falling below $2 anytime soon are one in a million
Make these 4 moves by year's end to take advantage of Trump’s new tax cuts
CarMax is leaving the S&P 500 for this famous industrial company’s spinoff
